item.title: Compare pro-code and no-code LCM apps
item.description: Compare high-code and no-code lifecycle management apps Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 770 Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Page type: Concept Content type: Explanation Explanations present a more detailed dive into a single topic compared to Conceptual Overviews. They aim to clarify specific elements of the technology, offering developers practical insights or in-depth clarification on particular points of interest.

item.title: Plan your LCM integration
item.description: Plan your lifecycle management app build Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 763 Is this a new page?: Existing doc: changes are needed to update the doc and to fit the new IA Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Changes to be made: For best effect, it makes sense to rework these articles to match “Plan your web application build” - i.e., to have a How-To \ Guide Hub style article that runs through the entire process of building a lifecycle-aware app.

item.title: Store your users across multiple tenants
item.description: Store your users across multiple tenants Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 462 Is this a new page?: Existing doc: changes are needed to update the doc and to fit the new IA Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Changes to be made: Change title, move definitions and theory of tenants and multi-tenants to Learn > OIDC > Tenants. This page is purely about helping the reader to understand and choose between the different ways to implement multi-tenant apps.

item.title: Centralize your users with Universal Directory
